properties.name: GRO Guatemala
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Antigua, GuatemalaGRO will send a delegation to Guatemala for the first time. We have been having a steady line of communications with our contacts in Guatemala and are excited to bring a group of deleagates to meet with Guatemalan delegates and focus on two primary identified issues in Guatemala: Education and Community Development. GRO offers a peer-to-peer program that matches up American Delegates with Deaf Guatemalan. The two groups will merge to share cultural experiences and issues within their respective Deaf communities.

properties.name: GRO Honduras
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Tegucigalpa, HondurasGRO will send a delegation to Honduras for the first time. We have been having a steady line of communications with our contacts in Honduras and are excited to bring a group of deleagates to meet with Honduran delegates and focus on two primary identified issues in Honduras: Education and Employment. GRO offers a peer-to-peer program that matches up American Delegates with Deaf Honduran. The two groups will merge to share cultural experiences and issues within their respective Deaf communities.

properties.name: GRO India
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Mumbai, IndiaGRO\'s second delegation from the U.S. traveled to Mumbai, India in summer of 2007; the third delegation went to Bangalore, India within the same month. GRO experienced its first peer-to-peer programs in both Mumbai and Bangalore. In India, American delegates are matched up with deaf Indians, and the two groups merge to share cultural experiences and issues within their respective Deaf communities. They travel together to other deaf schools and visit with young students there. At the end of the three-week program, the American and Indian delegates present the ideas they shared with each other in role-play format to numerous members of the Indian Deaf community. Topics include common issues experienced within deaf communities across national borders (dinner table syndrome, media access, hearing stereotypes, educational options, etc.), with visual demonstrations of how to potentially approach and/or solve those issues.

properties.name: GRO India
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Kolkata, IndiaGRO will send a delegation to India for the second time. The location will be Kolkata, India, and the program will run from December 27, 2009 to January 12, 2010. Details are being worked out where we will be focusing two primary identified issues in India: education and health.

properties.name: GRO India
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Bangalore, IndiaGRO\'s second delegation from the U.S. traveled to Mumbai, India in summer of 2007; the third delegation went to Bangalore, India within the same month. GRO experienced its first peer-to-peer programs in both Mumbai and Bangalore. In India, American delegates are matched up with deaf Indians, and the two groups merge to share cultural experiences and issues within their respective Deaf communities. They travel together to other deaf schools and visit with young students there. At the end of the three-week program, the American and Indian delegates present the ideas they shared with each other in role-play format to numerous members of the Indian Deaf community. Topics include common issues experienced within deaf communities across national borders (dinner table syndrome, media access, hearing stereotypes, educational options, etc.), with visual demonstrations of how to potentially approach and/or solve those issues.

properties.name: GRO Kenya
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Nairobi, KenyaGRO have established line of communication with Kenya! Our next program will be aimed on the east coast of Kenya Africa near the town of Nairobi. We have identified our program coordinator and POC for Kenya - the program will take place July 29th to August 20th. The focus of the program will be Kenyan Youth Leadership Camp. US Delegates and Kenyan Delegates will work together to develop a curriculum for a 2 week camp for Deaf Kenyans in high school. This program will inlude hand-on works and opportunities to do community development on various projects projected for this program.

properties.name: GRO Thailand
properties.description: Posted by Tmood Bangkok, ThailandWe completed a successful second delegation to Thailand as of March 2008. Thirteen U.S. delegates traveled to Bangkok, Thailand, where they met many of their peers at the Sethsatian School for the Deaf. Three team leaders and their respective teams presented workshops over the course of two days on community development, following one\'s dreams, and identity discovery.
